frame.name: Volubility
frame.definition:
<def-root>These words describe the size of message that a <fen>Speaker</fen> is judged by a (usually unexpressed) <fen>Judge</fen> to give, either in a specific occasion or <fen>Topic</fen> or in general. As in other communication frames, <fen>Medium</fen> may also be expressed. <ex></ex> <ex>Graham is very shy with most people, but <fex name="Speaker">he</fex> <m>gets</m> <fex name="Degree">very</fex> <t>chatty</t> <fex name="Company">with Mr. Roberts</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Speaker">Evelyn</fex> <m>was</m> <fex name="Degree">very</fex> <t>voluble</t> <fex name="Topic">on the rights of women</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition: <def-root>This is the person who is characterized as talkative, reticent etc. It is usually the External Argument: <ex><fex name="Spkr">Pat</fex> has been <t>silent</t> on this issue.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Company
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Company</fen> in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> exhibits a certain communicative behavior. In this frame, <fen>Company</fen> occurs in PP Complements headed by <ment>with</ment>: <ex>Kim was <t>reticent</t> <fex name="Company">with me</fex> about her family.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Text
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Text</fen> is rarely expressed because the quantity of information given is the focus of the frame, rather than the information content. Texts can occur as NP objects, but cannot be either direct quotes or complement clauses.
<ex>Kim gave a hesitant, <t>reticent</t> <fex name="Text">account</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is the <fen>Topic</fen> on which much or little information is communicated. <fen>Topic</fen> is far more frequent than Message in this frame. <ex>Kim is very <t>talkative</t> <fex name="Top">about her family and childhood</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used to communicate, as in other Communication frames. It is usually a PP Complement headed by <ment>in</ment> or <ment>on</ment>.
<ex>Kim is <t>talkative</t> <fex name="Medium">on the phone</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>Degree to which the <fen>Speaker</fen> withholds or does not withhold information and conversation.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Manner in which the speaker is reticent or voluble.</def-root>

FE.name: Judge
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual whose point of view is taken in assigning the judgment denoted by the target.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: effusive.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: expressing gratitude, pleasure, or approval in an unrestrained manner

lexUnit.name: glib.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: articulate and voluble but insincere and shallow

lexUnit.name: laconic.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: using very few words; terse

lexUnit.name: loquacious.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: characeterized by or showing a tendency to talk a great deal

lexUnit.name: reticent.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not revealing one's thoughts or feelings readily

lexUnit.name: silent.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not prone to speak much

lexUnit.name: talkative.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: fond of or given to talking

lexUnit.name: chatty.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: fond of chatting

lexUnit.name: big mouth.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an indiscreet or boastful person.

lexUnit.name: brusque.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: abrupt or offhand.

lexUnit.name: curt.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: rudely brief.

lexUnit.name: expansive.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: relaxed, genial, and communicative.

lexUnit.name: garrulous.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: excessively talkative, especially on trivial matters.

lexUnit.name: gushing.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: speak or write effusively

lexUnit.name: gushy.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: -ier, -iest excessively effusive.

lexUnit.name: mum.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: 2: 1.in phr. keep mum informal remain silent so as not to reveal a secret.

lexUnit.name: voluble.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: speaking or spoken incessantly and fluently.

lexUnit.name: terse.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: .terser, tersest sparing in the use of words; abrupt.

lexUnit.name: uncommunicative.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: unwilling to talk or impart information.

lexUnit.name: loquacity.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: talkativeness

lexUnit.name: loudmouth.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: informal a person who talks too much, especially tactlessly.

lexUnit.name: chatterbox.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: informal a person who chatters.

lexUnit.name: reticence.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the act of not revealing one's thoughts or feelings readily

lexUnit.name: reserved.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: slow to reveal emotion or opinions.

lexUnit.name: taciturn.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: reserved or uncommunicative in speech; saying little.

lexUnit.name: mute.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: refraining from speech or temporarily speechless.

lexUnit.name: quiet.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: prone to stay silent; not talkative.
